TopicTitle: New Career game, can't attach fuel to a capsule - game freezes

Articles.Content:
I've played KSP for years, currently on version 1.11.0.3045 w/no mods. I wanted to start a new, Career, game. Started okay, but after my first mission, when I obtained fuel and engines, I tried adding an FL-T100 Fuel to a MK1 Command capsule. The fuel tank disappeared and the game froze, I couldn't even exit until I clicked 'New', then exit.

I resumed and with more missions using the RT-5 Flea, I acquired additional fuel options. I tried the FL-T200, but same problem. Oddly, I can start with a fuel tank and add a capsule, then re-root to the capsule, but adding a 2nd fuel tank (it disappears) causes the game to freeze.

Any advise would be appreciated.

Thanks, David
@drburns650 continue to reroot for now, I'll mention it to a dev friend of mine, and I also say report it in the bugtracker. If it's repeatable, then it will get fixed soon if I'd have to guess.

With some additional research, I've determined the problem is with the FL-100 and FL-T200 fuel tanks. They cannot be added to any capsule without the gameplay being corrupted, and only a 'New' clears the VAB to allow exit.

I'll go looking for the 'bugtracker' and add my comments.

Thanks, David

 

Edit: Logged into Squad Bugtracker and submitted the report.

Edited January 26, 2021 by drburns650
update on status

The same thing happens to me. Even when I drag out a FL-T100 and don't attach it to a capsule, then try to attach a Swivel engine to it, it won't attach.

Note that an FL-T100 attaches to a capsule just fine in sandbox mode - it's only in career mode where this is a problem.

I don't mean to necropost, but I had the same issue starting a science mode game and found a solution. After deleting the /Kerbal Space Program/GameData/Squad directory and verifying my game files in Steam, the issue went away.

On 1/31/2021 at 12:39 PM, That Don Guy said:

The same thing happens to me. Even when I drag out a FL-T100 and don't attach it to a capsule, then try to attach a Swivel engine to it, it won't attach.

Note that an FL-T100 attaches to a capsule just fine in sandbox mode - it's only in career mode where this is a problem.

I started a new Career game with the latest version, and got up to a FL-T200 engine...which has the same bug; when I attach it to a capsule, it disappears, and I can't attach anything underneath it. I also can't exit the VAB screen without exiting the entire game.

UPDATE: I did a full uninstall of KSP and loaded the latest version in full (which I had done before, but always over the previous version), and it works now. There might have been a mod that somehow managed to get passed from one previous install to another that was causing the problem.

Edited April 15, 2021 by That Don Guy
